str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Silvanus, a Roman citizen and a helper of Paul. Of Latin origin; 'silvan'; Silvanus, a Christian.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 1st Person Singular
str2: To reckon, count, charge with; reason, decide, conclude; think, suppose.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Trustworthy, faithful, believing. From peitho; objectively, trustworthy; subjectively, trustful.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: A primary verb; to 'grave', especially to write; figuratively, to describe.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Puny; especially neuter somewhat.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: From para and kaleo; to call near, i.e. Invite, invoke.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To testify earnestly, bear witness to. From epi and martureo; to attest further, i.e. Corroborate.
This; he, she, it.
I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Unconcealed, true, true in fact, worthy of credit, truthful. TRUE.
From chairo; graciousness, of manner or act.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.
